private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels: A, E, I, O, U.
I can only pick or place a block that is currently at the top of a stack.
I can only hold or move one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, and K is on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants: all letters except A, E, I, O, U.
I can only pick or place a block that is currently at the top of a stack.
I can only hold or move one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, and K is on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent capabilities and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that achieves the block reconfiguration target.

public_information: There are blocks labeled D, B, J, C, K, E, F, A, H, G, I.
Manipulation rules: only top blocks of stacks can be picked, and only one block can be moved at a time.
One agent may only move vowel-labeled blocks (A, E, I, O, U) and the other may only move consonant-labeled blocks.
Initial stacks on the table are: Stack1: D (bottom), J, E, F (top); Stack2: B (bottom), C, G, I (top); Stack3: K (bottom), A, H (top).
All blocks not listed on top are covered by blocks above them as described.
Goal configuration: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, and K on the table.

model.system_prompt: You are an expert in block manipulation capabilities and constraints. Describe precisely what actions you can perform, preconditions and effects of those actions, and any assumptions you require to operate. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a structured description of operators, predicates you need, and any naming conventions you expect.
model.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a clear, structured model of your available actions, the predicates you assume, preconditions and effects for each action, and any limitations or unresolved assumptions. Output the result as the artifact name model_vowel_agent.

model.system_prompt: You are an expert in block manipulation capabilities and constraints. Describe precisely what actions you can perform, preconditions and effects of those actions, and any assumptions you require to operate. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a structured description of operators, predicates you need, and any naming conventions you expect.
model.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a clear, structured model of your available actions, the predicates you assume, preconditions and effects for each action, and any limitations or unresolved assumptions. Output the result as the artifact name model_consonant_agent.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning for FastDownwards. Integrate the provided agent capability models into a single coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the initial and goal block configurations. Target the FastDownwards planner: use STRIPS-style PDDL with types and actions that FastDownwards accepts. Keep the actions of the two agents distinct and preserve their capability constraints (vowel-only vs consonant-only). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Ensure predicates, action names, and object typing are consistent and that the problem is solvable given the constraints.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Vowel agent model: {model_vowel_agent}. Consonant agent model: {model_consonant_agent}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the two agent models, resolve naming differences, and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem pair suitable for FastDownwards. Keep agent actions named to indicate which agent performs them (for example, move-vowel-... and move-consonant-...). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
